Over the next two weeks I’m looking forward to meeting with State Represenatives County Commissioners Mayors Law Enforcement Business Leaders and Constituents in all 22 counties of Colorado’s 4th District.   It’s an honor to represent you.
My office helped Denise from Parker receive a loan that helped her family stay afloat while her husband is out of work. My staff is still working with her now to help ensure these loans are forgiven.
My office helped Greg from Castle Pines who owns a health care facility in the district secure a PPP loan. He told my staff that without this PPP loan he would have needed to lay off his staff.
My office helped Bruce who lives in Longmont and owns a travel agency and is self-employed receive unemployment insurance under the CARES Act.

My office helped Laurie in Sedalia who owns a construction company secure a PPP loan that saved her business.   She called my office a “lifesaver” and said she would have gone out of business without our office helping her receive this PPP loan.
My office has helped 113 individuals and businesses receive COVID-related assistance.   This includes receiving individual stimulus checks PPP loans and other small business assistance.
I fought to secure $28 million in funding to build the Arkansas Valley Conduit that will bring clean drinking and irrigation water to Southeast Colorado.

Both of these bills directly assist #CO04 by:  1) recognizing and memorializing the district’s history   2) ensuring that pharmaceutical manufacturers and pharmacies are sharing data necessary to curb the opioid epidemic
I also introduced and shepherded the Amache Study Act and the Using Data to Prevent Opioid Diversion Act to the President’s desk.
This includes passing the WATER Act in the House which directly benefits rural water users farmers and ranchers with lowered water costs.
I’m proud of the work I’ve accomplished in Washington for Colorado’s 4th District.   I’ve stood with our farmers and focused on growing our economy.
I am so proud to have the support of my good friend @CynthiaMLummis.   Thank you for joining us today Cynthia! https://t.co/HGoauRJsIp

I worked with the Rocky Mountain Hyperbaric Association and my friends at the Rocky Mountain Hyperbaric Institute and the VA’s Center for Compassionate Care Initiative to set up a first-of-its kind pilot program to provide veterans with Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy.

I helped pass the The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. It’s given an average family of four an additional $2000 in their pockets. In fact approximately 82% of middle class families received tax relief for Coloradans.
I also helped secure $700000 in Airport Improvement Grant funds for the Vance Brand Memorial Airport.
I clinched $5.4 million in BUILD Grant funds to begin construction on the Crystal Valley Interchange in Douglas County.
My office has helped 113 individuals and businesses receive COVID-related assistance. This includes receiving individual stimulus checks PPP loans and other small business assistance.
I’m proud of what I’ve accomplished for Colorado’s 4th Congressional District.
